moves.1. d4: White opens up with queens pawn...
moves.4. Nf3 Bb4 5. Bd2 c5: hmmm, maybe a little gambit here?
moves.6... Bxc5 7. Na4: knight on the rim is dim...
moves.9. Bxd7+ Qxd7: queen takes instead because I want the knight out of my sight.
moves.10. b3: interesting move... leaving the knight in the corner.
moves.14. O-O Rfc8: hmmm rook to an open file seems good especially on that weak c-pawn.
moves.16. h3 b5: attacking the white knight at a4 knight which will eventually lead to a pawn advantage.
moves.22. Rc1 Rxc1+: I decided to trade here not to give up my open file.
moves.23. Nxc1 Ba3: hmm i don't like the knight.
moves.26. Kf1 Bxc1: why not trade? knights are better than bishops in endgames.
moves.27. Nxc1 a5 28. Ke1: looks like white has to use the king to protect the pawn to free his knight.
moves.29. Kd2 Kf7 30. Kc2 Ke7: time for the king to attack
moves.31. Kb2 Nb5: moving knight to b5 will prevent white pushing pawn to a3
moves.32. Ne2 h5: This is the losing move for me pushing pawn to h5 will lead white knight to f4, if i push pawn h4, knight to g6 check!
moves.33. Nd4: luckily white made the wrong move haha, sign of relief.
moves.33... Nxd4: why not trade when you are winning.
moves.36. Kd3 g4: free up a little space for my king to get through huh?
moves.37. h4: white responds, nope you are not gonna get it.
moves.37... f4: well I always got other pawns to push
moves.38... g3: hm why not push pawn to get him all jammed up.
moves.39. Kd3 Kf5: oh boy time for me to make my move.
moves.40. Ke2 e5: this forces white to trade pawns, if white king to d3 black pawn toe e4 check? not sure about it.
moves.41... Kxe5 42. Kd3: hmm looks like a draw from here xD.
moves.42... Kd6: not giving up my kings position.
moves.43. Ke2: smart move white king to e2 instead of d4 if white king to d4, black king to c6 and whites king is force to move back which leads black king to c5 gaining a whole significant advantage in position.
moves.43... Kc6 44. Kd2: smart move not falling for any tricks keeping king away from d3. if white king to d3 black king to c5 which forces white king to retreat back.
moves.44... Kc5 45. Kd3: looks like a draw now would you say?
moves.45... a4: pawn sacrafice, also my game winning move.
moves.46. bxa4: white of course takes if white doesnt take white will have to give up his/her king's position.
moves.46... Kb6: setting up for my king to charge in on the right side.
moves.47. Kd4: take my free pawn if you wish I don't care haha.
moves.49. Kc4: not going to let you push that pawn white says.
moves.52. Kc4 Kc2 53. Kd4 Kd2: looks like my deep pawn structure prevails.
moves.54. Ke4 Ke2 55. Kxf4 Kf2: hahahaha, I will get my queen first.
moves.56. Ke5 Kxg2 57. f4: pawn storming, sorry its too late.
moves.60. f7 Qg7+: nope you are not going to make it.
moves.61. Ke6 Qf8: I will make sure you won't get it mwahahah.
moves.62. Kf6 Kxh4:
well doesn't matter I got room to promote my pawn to another queen. White resigns from here.
Kudos to me. I got my first mini tournament game won.
